page.title: 05BURTON GREEN VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Burton Green Village Hall was built by a local builder and opened in 1983. It replaced an old brick and wood building and cost about Â£45,000. It is approximately 30feet by 70feet. It is used every day during the week except Sunday for various activities such as old people's groups, mother and toddler groups, playgroups, Brownies, Guides, Cubs, Scouts, dancing and popmobility classes. The Women's Institute use it once a month and sometimes the village school use it for school plays and concerts. A Coventry dancing school use it on Saturday mornings for rehearsals. At weekends the hall can be hired for table tennis, children's parties, wedding receptions, dances or barbecues. It is used for elections and twice a year local people can come here to pay their rates.
